intro: Diaphananthe polyantha, commonly known as the pink-flowered diaphananthe, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its clustered pink or white flowers, which bloom in spring. It typically grows as an understory plant in tropical forests, preferring humid and shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
